entry.title: The original racist emoji issue
entry.content:
Over at Ratter, Iâ€™ve written about how the unrecognized character symbol is showing up in an unfortunate context with the new emoji-of-color, and how this all relates to an Ur-issue of emoji racism. In my opinion, the moment this became an issue was when Apple exported emoji that mostly looked white to us.

After all, the Unicode Consortium only provides the list of possible emoji to platforms like Apple, Android, and Twitter â€” itâ€™s up to the platforms to actually draw them. Platforms like Apple got a descriptions from the Unicode Consortium like â€œHAPPY PERSON RAISING ONE HANDâ€ or â€œPOLICE OFFICERâ€ and they created the pictures weâ€™re all familiar with. Because Apple was one of the first platforms to draw emoji, their versions â€” which feature mostly white faces â€” became the canon.

This was harder to write than I expected, but I think itâ€™s an interesting and surprisingly convoluted issue. Hopefully this explanation helps people understand some of the forces at play here.
